result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed, and taken only as prescribed.
Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
DEOJ Agreement
Approving DEOJ Agreement

1:55 p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF336 and 22CM251

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Peter Vu.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
22CF336
COUNT 2: Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, PTAC >> DRI.
22CM251
COUNT 1: Battery, Domestic Abuse >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF336
COUNT 1: Manuf/Deliver THC (<=200g), PTAC >> NO CONTEST.
COUNT 3: Possess Drug Paraphernalia, PTAC >> NO CONTEST. 
22CM251
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt on count 1 of 22CF336- COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.

COURT defers Count 1 on 22CF336 for a period of 18 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.1.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty on remaining counts.

On 22CF336, Count 3 and 22CM251, Count 2:
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; SAFE Program; AODA and f/u; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week; Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; I/S 30 days jail for rules violations and PRH on 22CM251; DNA sample and surcharge; DV surcharge in 22CM251; and CC. 2 days jail credit if revoked. 

PRH - 11/18/22 at 1:15 p.m.

Adj: 2:15 p.m.
Re: Order Approving DEOJ Agreement
Plea hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
